intro: Hieracium cuspididentatum, commonly known as the sharp-toothed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium cuspididentatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to different environmental conditions.
